definitions.definition: A thing that is not dispensable; a necessity.
Not admitting ecclesiastical dispensation; not subject to release or exemption; that cannot be allowed by bending the canonical rules.
(of duties, rules etc.) Unbendable, that cannot be set aside or ignored.
definitions.example: The law was moral and indispensable. -Bp. Burnet

definitions.definition: Absolutely necessary or requisite; that one cannot do without.
definitions.example: An indispensable component of a heart-healthy diet.
